description.narrative: Goal: A Corruption-free Liberia where Citizens Act with Transparency and Integrity in All their Dealings. Specific Objectives: 1. To Increase Citizens’ Access to Relevant Information and Mechanisms to Demand for and Take Actions Against Corruption by December 2024; 2. To Increase Advocacy for Prevention and Prosecution Efforts Against Corruption by December 2024; and 3. To Strengthen the Capacity of CENTAL to effectively play her independent monitoring and advocacy roles by December 2024.

Corruption is endemic within the Liberian society. The growing trend of public sector corruption has crippled Liberia’s governance mechanisms, weakened the rule of law, impaired service delivery and undermined active citizens’ participation in the larger democratic governance process.
The intervention's objective and various activities are directly addressing corruption in line with the national priorities in particular Pillar 4 (Governance) of the Pro Poor Agenda for Prosperity and Development (PAPD) and in particular the priority area on Reducing Corruption.
The anticipated results of the programme are threefold: 1) To Increase Citizens’ Access to Relevant Information to Demand and Take Actions Against Corruption; 2) To Increase strategic advocacy efforts of anti-corruption and promote good governance; and 3) To Strengthen the Capacity of the Center for accountability and Transparency in Liberia (CENTAL) to effectively lead the civil society voice against Corruption in Liberia.
The first year of implementation will be an inception phase. The inception phase will include milestone achievements to be realized during the year, and would also provide an opportunity for CENTAL to design a robust and forward-looking programme document and accompanying results framework and budget, conclude an action plan for the implementation of the recommendations from the systems audit, re-structure the board of CENTAL so that it reflects diversity and inclusivity and recruiting key staff such as a gender officer.

Korruptionen är vitt utbredd i det liberiska samhället. Den ökande trenden med korruption i den offentliga sektorn har påverkat samhällsstyrningen negativt, försvagat rättsstatsprincipen, försämrat tillhandahållandet av samhällstjänster och underminerat aktiva medborgares deltagande inom demokratisk samhällsstyrning.
Insatsens mål och aktiviteter syftar till att motarbeta korruption i enlighet med prioriteringarna i den nationella utvecklingsagendan och det prioriterade sakområdet vilket är att motarbeta korruption i samhället.
Programmets förväntade resultat är: 1) Att öka medborgarnas tillgång till relevant information för att kräva och vidta åtgärder mot korruption; 2) Att öka främjandet av antikorruption bland medborgarna samt god samhällsstyrning; och 3) Att stärka kapaciteter hos Center for Transparency and Accountability in Liberia (CENTAL) för att effektivt leda det civila samhällets röst mot korruption i Liberia.
Det första året kommer genomföras med en inledningsfas, s.k. inception-fas. Fasen kommer omfatta milstolpar som skall genomföras under första året, ge en möjlighet för CENTAL att utveckla ett robust programdokument, resultatramverk samt budget, färdigställa en plan för genomförande av rekommendationerna från systemrevisonen, omstrukturera CENTAL's styrelse så den reflekterar mångfald och inklusivitet samt att CENTAL kan rekrytera personal däribland en jämställdhetsrådgivare.

description.narrative: CENTAL has been implementing the NIBA programme successfully since Augist 2020 and is well on track with the implementation of the milestone deliverables. Beyond those deliverables, CENTAL is also implementing significant outputs of the programme document, including the Integrity Club (i-Club), the Advocacy and Legal Advice Center (ALAC), the Integrity Watch Radio (i-Watch), and other key programme outputs. These are all aimed at fostering a larger citizen involvement in the fight against corruption and during this inception year, these experiences will be key elements of the anticipated longer term programme document, which is to be sent to the Embassy as a result of the inception year.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
